intro: Rinorea apiculata, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Rinorea apiculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
